title.narrative: Readiness Support to strengthen Uganda’s engagement with the GCF

description.narrative: Project aims at providing early-stage support to enable the country to access the Green Climate Fund (GCF) and other climate finance sources through the nominated entities.
Undertaking a two-year GCF Readiness and Preparatory Support Programme (RPSP). The Readiness program builds on Uganda’s earlier efforts to strengthen its engagement with the GCF

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development (MoFPED)

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04564 Republic of Korea

description.narrative: Expenditure
Incoming Funds

title.narrative: Contingency (5%)
Delivery Partner fees

NDA/focal point lead effective coordination mechanism

description.narrative: BTORs, Minutes of meeting, training reports
equipment procured

title.narrative: 20fully trained representatives on the Inter-ministerial Standing Committee (ISC) on Climate Finance. (December 31, 2019)
At least six fully trained GCF officers within the NDA. (December 31, 2019)
Coordination mechanism reviewed and updated. NDA/focal point lead effective coordination mechanism. (July 31, 2019)
GCF communication strategy and action plan established (July 31, 2019)
Number of capacity building activities that align with IO1 and IO2.
Six NDA staff from relevant units and five members of the ISC visit Ethiopia’s and or Rwanda’s NDA and learned from their experience. (December, 31, 2019)
TOR of the ISC reviewed and Updated. (July 31, 2019)
Country Capacity Strengthened

meeting minutes

title.narrative: Monitoring, oversight and streamlining of climate finance
NDA/focal point lead effective coordination mechanism
No objection procedure established and implemented
Increased green finance flows for projects that implement the Uganda Green Growth Development Strategy (UGGDS).

description.narrative: Concept notes and projects funded by GCF and other financiers

description.narrative: Consultation reports

title.narrative: At least 5NDA staff members trained to maintain and update the web portal.
NDA led government-private sector and NGO dialogue platform developed and implemented annually during the 24-month period of this readiness proposal
Web Portal for the NDA on the MoFPED website developed
Stakeholder consultations conducted with equal representation of women

description.narrative: Consultation reports, copies of the guidelines

title.narrative: Guidelines are developed and adopted by the NDA.
Country programmes, concept notes, including on adaptation, developed that implement high-impact priorities identified in NDCs and other national strategies or plans

description.narrative: Copies of the Country and concept notes program

title.narrative: 5 -day training on project proposal and programme development is delivered for ca. 40 participants from KCCA, NEMA, UDB and the NDA. (December 31, 2020)
Ten project concept notes developed and submitted to the NDA for submission to the GCF or other potential investors/financiers. (December 31, 2020)
Three stakeholder workshop with ca. 50 participants to prioritize and validate projects. (December 31, 2020)
Entity/ies annual/multi-annual work programme developed

description.narrative: Copies of the work programmes for the DAEs

title.narrative: A project/programme pipeline is developed that will be the backbone of the KCCA post-accreditation work programme. The concept notes developed under outcome 4 will be included in the KCCA project pipeline, aligned with the mandate and objectives of KCCA. The pipeline will not be limited to those concept notes. (November 31, 2020)

Long-term capacity building needs to implement the KCCA work programmes are identified. The capacity building programme to address the identified gaps is developed with KCCA and summarized in a report. (November 31, 2020)
Country programmes, including adaptation priorities, developed and continuously updated

description.narrative: Copy of the refreshed country program

title.narrative: Members of the Climate Change Projects Development Committee participated in training on GCF project development.
Revised ToRs and an action plan for the Climate Change Projects Development Committee are approved by the NDA
“Uganda’s Green Climate Fund Country Programme” (April 2016) is updated, including information and feedback from the private sector and NGO dialogue platform
Direct access entity accredited

description.narrative: Letters of accreditation from GCF

title.narrative: Accreditation action plans are prepared for KCCA, NEMA and UDB with targets and implementation timeline to meet accreditation criteria and build entities’ capacity. KCCA’s(updated) accreditation application is submitted to the GCF. (June 30, 2020)
Information gaps and missing documentation identified in a summary report.( August 31, 2019)
Material documenting the application process prepared in English. (September 30, 2020)

Three 1-day training workshops conducted with approximately 40people participating in each workshop. Two out of three workshops will cover the identification and preparation of bankable project proposals for climate finance to complement activity (June 30,2020)
Twelve KCCA staff from relevant units have visited Ethiopia’s or Rwanda’s DAEs and NDAs to learn from their experience. (June 19, 2020)
Direct access realized

description.narrative: Letters of accreditation

title.narrative: Direct access entity accredited

At least twenty fully trained representatives of the ISC. (January 31, 2020)
M&E tools are adopted by the NDA to monitor GCF and related climate finance portfolio. (December 31, 2019)
No objection procedure established and implemented

description.narrative: No objection procedure document and minutes of the meeting

title.narrative: No-Objection procedure, including its “Annex - Technical review checklist for the evaluation of project proposals to the Green Climate Fund by the NDA”, refined and approved by the NDA and ISC. (August 31, 2019)
User friendly project evaluation guidelines are developed, including for a prioritization of national climate change-related interventions. (August 31, 2019)
